title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Staten Island University Hospital
Interview Descriptions: I met with Human Resources and I was asked a series of questions. I was called back for a second interview with the director of the position a few days later.
Interview Questions: Tell me about your background. Tell me about a difficult experience you had with a patient and how you handled it.

title: EEG Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Staten Island University Hospital (Staten Island, NY) in Feb 2019
Interview Descriptions: Very misleading. The interviewer was new to the job and quite inexperienced. She made the process confusing. She did not go over my resume before the interview either like she should have done.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Staten Island University Hospital (Staten Island, NY) in May 2018
Interview Descriptions: Very straightforward. The interviewer had a list of questions that I believe are the same between interviewees. After I met with HR person, I met with manager. Quick interview with manager. Didn't get tour of unit, took a while to hear back with job offer.
Interview Questions:
1. Tell me about yourself
2. Why Northwell/ nursing? 
3. Describe yourself in 3 words
4. What can you offer us?

title: Clerical Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Staten Island University Hospital
Interview Descriptions: It was pretty straightforward. First data entry and typing test were taken. Then human resources interviewed first for an hour. They said I had been approved for a second round interview. Which was less of an interview and more talking about what my duties would be.

title: Clerical Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Staten Island University Hospital (Staten Island, NY)
Interview Descriptions: Typing test, HR interview. Supervisor explained what was required and the hours that would be needed IE: every other weekend. Questions asked were simple and it was important that you showed some people skills.

title: Clinical Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Staten Island University Hospital (Staten Island, NY)
Interview Descriptions: In Person with Hr, Project Manager, and CIO.  The HR interview was to see if you are a fit for the company culture.  Project manager was technical and CIO was to see if you were a good fit for the team.

title: RN Med/Surg Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Staten Island University Hospital (Staten Island, NY) in Feb 2016
Interview Descriptions: Short and to the point, manager was slightly intimidating. I heard from an offer one week after the interview. Some managers will ask for recommendations but definitely a resume is needed
Interview Questions: What are your strengths and weaknesses?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Staten Island University Hospital in May 2015
Interview Descriptions: I was an internal employee. I submitted my resume through HR. A few hiring managers called me. I took a interview with one, and later got the job. After that initial interview. I had a second interview with HR and completed paperwork and documentation for employment.
Interview Questions: What can I bring to their work environment.

title: Assistant Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Staten Island University Hospital (Staten Island, NY) in May 2015
Interview Descriptions: was easy and short, asked about managerial experience and computer skills, job was offered within a week and   hiring process took 2 months . orientation was about a month . overall experience was good, but salary was a little less than expected

title: Speech Student Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Staten Island University Hospital
Interview Descriptions: the interview for this job was not bad, questions were asked about disorders, diseases, subtypes, and client populations and situations. all questions asked were within the student scope of the field. the person who interviewed made me feel comfortable and did not bombard me with questions. rather, the interview began with her asking me my interests in the field.
Interview Questions: how would you begin assessment/treatment with a client that presented with (fill in the blank)

title: RPSGT Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Staten Island University Hospital (Staten Island, NY)
Interview Descriptions: during the interview it went smoothly. I was interested in a new field. I had seen an article in the paper by dr. ciccone and felt it was anew and expanding field. steve grenard was a pleasure to work with and made the process interesting. he was the best manager ever.
Interview Questions: there was nothing difficult about the interview-I was honest

title: Patient Care Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Staten Island University Hospital (Staten Island, NY) in May 2013
Interview Descriptions: Interview waa not hard at all they just try to see if you have the personality to work with people and if i had any prior experience qorking in this field. They will ask your future goals and usually people working in The hospital they have. Are trying to become nurse doctors or physicans.
Interview Questions: What kind of experince do i have for this job

title: Trainer Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Staten Island University Hospital (Staten Island, NY) in Mar 2011
Interview Descriptions: The hiring process was fairly easy with an interview with the department manager and then recruiter.  It took about two months before a call back.  The hospital did several background checks.
Interview Questions: Qualification of how I would fit well within the department and organization.

title: Clerical Associate Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Staten Island University Hospital (Staten Island, NY) in Oct 2010
Interview Descriptions: Interview process went well. Interviewer was very nice and personable.
Interview Questions: How is your attendance and do you take a lot of time off when you're working?
